title: Spells (Chapter Overview)
excerpt: A general introduction to how spells function in the game, covering fundamental concepts. Detailed rules are found in sub-entries under 'Spellcasting Mechanics'.

subEntries.title: Gaining and Preparing Spells
subEntries.excerpt: Details how characters learn new spells and prepare them for casting, including rules for always-prepared spells and changing prepared spells.

subEntries.title: Spell Level & Slots
subEntries.excerpt: Explains spell levels as an indicator of power and spell slots as the resource for casting level 1+ spells, including rules for casting without slots and using higher-level slots.

subEntries.title: Schools of Magic
subEntries.excerpt: Describes the eight schools of magic (Abjuration, Conjuration, etc.) that categorize spells based on their typical effects.

subEntries.title: Casting Time Rules
subEntries.excerpt: Details the rules for spell casting times, including Magic action, Bonus Action, Reaction, longer casting times, and the one spell slot per turn rule.

subEntries.title: Spell Range Rules
subEntries.excerpt: Explains how a spell's range (Distance, Touch, Self) determines where its effect can originate.

subEntries.title: Spell Components (V, S, M)
subEntries.excerpt: Details the physical requirements for casting spells: Verbal (V), Somatic (S), and Material (M) components, including spellcasting focuses and component pouches.

subEntries.title: Spell Duration Rules
subEntries.excerpt: Explains how long a spell's effects persist, covering Concentration, Instantaneous durations, and fixed Time Spans (rounds, minutes, hours).

subEntries.title: Spell Effects (Targets, Saves, Attacks)
subEntries.excerpt: Details how spell effects are determined, including targeting rules (clear path, self, AoE), saving throws, attack rolls, and combining spell effects.
